job_title: Product Manager, TikTok LIVE - Trust & Safety
job_Description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community. As a product manager on our Trust & Safety team, you will work with teams of engineers, data scientists, operations, product policies and various relevant internal teams to build safety product features and strategies. You will be working on safety features, technical strategies to improve our trust and safety processes, as well methods to detect and address the risky behaviors and actors in the community. You will also work on project management to deliver major Trust and Safety product changes. When it's safe, travel between our global offices is expected. This role is also at the junction with a fast-growing vertical of our platform - Tiktok LIVE, partnering with other product teams at the global scale to solve ever-changing challenges in the most impactful ways. It provides great learning opportunities for anyone looking for a meaningful place to work, to solve challenging problems. If that sounds like something you're passionate about, we'd love to hear from you. What will I be doing?  Drive product strategy and build features to protect the integrity of content on the platform, the safety of our creators and provide the best possible experience for our LIVE users.  Define product roadmap, set metrics that inform the success of safety efforts, work with the cross functional teams to implement product solutions.  Analyze data, conduct users interviews and user research, make strategic decisions based on data and metrics.  What should I bring with me?  2 or more years of full-time experience in product management in web internet companies, or entrepreneurial experience of founding and leading your own tech start-up. Candidates with experiences at top-tier consulting companies could also be considered.  Highly data-driven, capable of in-depth data interpretation, able to dive deep into data to distill user insights and articulate the problems in a clear manner to cross-functional teams.  Have strong empathy with users and be able to design product solutions based on evidence; proven track record of pushing ambitious products, and/or organizational or process changes.  Be a team player, mission-driven and highly motivated.   Even better if:   Experience and expertise in content moderation and quality, safety & abuse, and other safety-related initiatives.  Experience in working with cross functional partners across different time zones, cultures and languages.  Experience of starting a new company, organization or initiative is a strong plus.  Trust & Safety is committed to the wellbeing of all our employees. Our promise is to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

The Role As an Autonomy Camera Software Engineer, your technical skills will be applied to a variety of components within the imaging pipeline and software stack to optimize system performance and fundamentally improve image quality for computer vision. By partnering closely with hardware, computer vision, and system software engineers, you will be part of a cross functional, ongoing initiative of delivering the best possible view of the world for consumption by neural networks and driver-facing displays. Your code will connect with cameras, image signal processors, neural networks, codecs, telemetry, and other components executing on the FSD computer. Additionally, the camera software team builds tools for benchmarking, characterizing, and optimizing camera 3A and ISP configurations, and is responsible for testing and evaluation of software frameworks to ensure the system and functional stability of our stack. Responsibilities Write, debug and maintain robust C/C++ software for the Autopilot and our Humanoid robot software stack; you will work on code related to our high-framerate Camera & Vision stack, write GPU kernels, implement and profile system frameworks, or improve/extend codecs for video collection Architect, tune, and evaluate camera control and image processing algorithms for the next-generation FSD system Iterate on new features through simulation, testing, and targeted fleet data analysis Develop and maintain image quality analysis tools Define requirements and coordinate with relevant vehicle subsystems, manufacturing, service, and other teams to optimize optical performance and reliability Generalize software frameworks when necessary while keeping in mind that too much abstraction can sometimes become a bottleneck Requirements  Practical experience programming in C/C++ software, including modern C/C++ (C++14/17/20), multithreading, and Python. Cuda/OpenCL experience a plus. Knowledge of digital camera systems and related concepts, including color filters, exposure control, timing, drivers, and in-sensor HDR techniques. Experience with imager bring-up. Experience or familiarity with ISP pipelines, drivers, and associated tunings Experience or familiarity with Computer Vision, Machine Learning & related software concepts Experience with performant embedded software design, object-oriented C++ Proficient developing software on a Linux host, for embedded Linux targets a plus

Position Overview Our machine learning team is seeking an experienced senior machine learning engineer. The team is in need of someone who is a skilled software engineer and proficient in ML libraries, system design and pipelines. As a machine learning engineer, you will be building state-of-the-art models for our products, using test driven development, and working with the software engineering team to deploy and maintain the models in production.    Job Duties/Responsibilities Design, train and deliver machine learning solutions to a wide range of datasets: from small datasets to big data, time series to 3D matrices, both unlabeled and labeled Collaborate with the development team and ML engineers to implement, test and validate new algorithms and integrate the algorithms with the existing frontend and backend systems. Build state-of-the-art models for various modeling tasks (e.g., time series forecasting, spatiotemporal and traffic/logistic) Optimize and automate model training and testing, experimentation tracking, development, and production. Skilled in breaking down problems, documenting problem statements and estimating efforts Mentor junior engineers, perform code reviews and document design decisions Create web services/APIs for serving ML/AI model results.   Minimum Qualifications PhD or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar field 5+ years of experience with one modern language such as Java, C++, Python including object-oriented design. 3+ years of experience with machine learning tools and deep learning algorithms and techniques, including but not limited to: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras CNN, LSTM, RNN Scikit-learn, pandas, numpy Optimization techniques and fine-tuning models 3+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems. Experience with MLOps and other production level implementation frameworks and pipelines Experience with messaging systems, Docker, Kubernetes, Spark, EMR, and cloud platforms (AWS or Azure) Able to work independently on problems and in highly collaborative team environments. Preferred Qualifications Team management and mentoring junior members Graph-based Machine Learning Research experience with high impact publications Application of ML in industrial projects Please note: Due to COVID-19, all positions at Beyond Limits are currently remote. However, once our offices are fully reopened, most work is expected to be performed in-person at our main headquarters in Glendale, CA. About Beyond Limits  Beyond Limits is a pioneering Artificial Intelligence engineering company creating advanced software solutions that go beyond conventional AI. Founded in 2014 with a legacy in space exploration, Beyond Limits is transforming proven technologies from Caltech and NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory into advanced AI solutions, hardened to industrial strength, and put to work for forward-looking companies on earth. We leverage this unparalleled innovation portfolio, along with proprietary cognitive technologies, to help companies solve tough, complex, mission-critical problems and transform their business. We apply a unique hybrid approach to AI, combining numeric AI techniques like machine learning with higher-order symbolic AI and expert human knowledge to deliver intuitive cognitive reasoning and information. Our cognitive computing technology mimics human thought processes and provides explainable reasoning to aid human-like decision-making.  Beyond Limits provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Beyond Limits complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.  Beyond Limits expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Beyond Limit’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Iterative Scopes is seeking a manager for their machine learning and data science teams. The successful candidate will be part of the ML leadership team and manage a group machine learning engineers and data scientists. They work collaboratively with our product and clinical teams to deliver quality AI products on time. The candidate will have a track record of developing machine learning and especially deep learning and computer vision models for solving challenging real-world scientific problems.  Key Responsibilities Own the technical direction and impact of their team  Collaborate with a cross functional team that include Product, Clinical, and Regulatory affairs  Work with direct reports to understand their motivations and develop their career paths  Formulate an effective strategy for recruiting and retaining high performing and collaborative engineers and data scientists  Requirements & Qualifications Minimum Qualifications:  Graduate Degree in computer science or other quantitative fields, or Bachelor of Science with similar practical experience in an industrial or research setting.  6+ Years’ experience in data science and/or machine learning  Previous experience in leading or managing machine learning and/or data science teams  Experience hiring data scientists and/or machine learning engineers  4+ Years’ experience with developing, troubleshooting, and validating deep learning models working in the areas of video and image processing.  Knowledge of computer vision tasks including detection, segmentation, and classification.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to describe complex technical concepts to colleagues with varying degrees of technical background  Preferred Qualifications:  Experience in the medical device or healthcare industry  Experience working with more data types (e.g. EMR, genomics, biometrics, images).  Experience deploying machine learning models to production.  Experience working in startup environments.  Benefits Medical, Dental, Vision, and Disability  Maternity/Paternity leave  Flexible time off  Wellness perks  IT / Workspace benefits  Commuter benefits, including subsidized parking  401K  Stock Options   About Iterative Scopes The Iterative Scopes mission is to empower doctors with real-time computer-aided detection and diagnostic tools powered by state-of-the-art computer vision and machine learning technology; improving patient outcomes by helping gastroenterologists detect and classify lesions in real-time, including those that often elude the human eye; and improving care worldwide by providing doctors across the globe with access to deep neural networks trained by the world’s best and most experienced GI specialists.  Iterative Scopes is a venture-backed company established by Jonathan Ng, MBBS a second-time founder. The company has raised over $195M and is on track to be one of the fastest-growing MIT startups. The scientific advisory board includes world-class gastroenterologists primarily based in Boston and leading MIT computer vision and machine learning researchers and faculty.

job_title: Data Scientist, Data Science and Analytics
job_Description: QuestBridge is a national nonprofit program that connects outstanding low-income students with educational opportunities that can change their lives, as well as the demographics of our nation's leading educational institutions.  The Data Scientist position offers a unique opportunity for someone passionate about bringing their data and technical experiences to enhance educational programs and contribute to the growth of a far-reaching entrepreneurial social venture. Reporting to the Director of Data Science and Analytics (DSA), this person will lead, manage, and execute on data-related operations and initiatives, often working across multiple teams at QuestBridge.  Our Data Scientist will have the opportunity to collaborate with program, data, and engineering team members across other departments for thought partnership, feedback, and growth. In addition to technical experience, this position has a strong focus on rigor, communication, project management, and systems-thinking. If you will enjoy applying your skills to data projects that fuel QuestBridge's mission, we look forward to reviewing your application!  Role and Responsibilities  Success of this role is defined by achieving the following:   Accurate and efficient implementation of tools, models, and other data operations related to our College Programs, College Partnerships, and other programmatic efforts across QuestBridge  Improvements in QuestBridge's data consistency, accuracy, and usage  Detailed understanding of the limits and potential of QuestBridge data  Detailed understanding of data used in all analytics projects (including visualizations that help others gain clarity for decision-making)  Well-documented code that others can easily reuse and/or build upon  Timely and relevant analyses and reports for operational use  Completion of complex reporting and analysis requests  Creation and maintenance of documentation of QuestBridge data and data processes  Ability to support data-related operational tasks across the organization  Travel to events to interact and support students and apply these experiences to continuously improve programming  Read and evaluate student applications for the College Prep Scholars Program, National College Match, and other various opportunities  Other duties, as assigned  Minimum Qualifications  Relevant work experience or training of at least 4 years  Demonstrated experience working in a centralized role that requires collaboration with many teams across a given organization  Experience leading a project from ideation to implementation  Previous success in leading data initiatives for impact (scoping, managing stakeholders, visualization, insights, improved decision-making)  Ability to leverage best coding practices to conduct data cleaning, data wrangling, analyses, and build data products  Familiarity with some or all of the following: SQL  Python (Pandas, Scikit Learn, etc.)  R  Git  Statistics  Functional programming  Exceptional attention to detail, with ability to maintain focus on the larger picture  Strong written, and verbal communication skills  Ability to manage multiple projects from start to finish (organizing bandwidth, workflows, and multiple deliverables for on-time delivery) in fast-paced environments  Ability to incorporate feedback  Track record of taking initiative  Passion for QuestBridge's mission  Preferred Qualifications  Master's Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or another quantitative field  Experience working with data in the education sector  Track record of producing analyses that result in meaningful decision-making  Experience increasing efficiency of processes, and automation of analyses and reporting  Experience using CRM platforms and application  Experience with using data science and machine learning techniques to help teams and organizations better serve their constituents  Compensation  Competitive compensation is commensurate with experience and skills for the position.  Hours and Location of Work  This is a full-time position remote within the US. Employees will be expected to be engaged online and travel approximately once per quarter.  Application Process  Please include a thoughtful cover letter with your application, and a sample of past data-related projects and any relevant code from the project. Apply Now!  Thank you for your interest in employment with QuestBridge. QuestBridge is an equal opportunity employer.

location: 4440 El Camino Real, Los Altos, CA 94022
job_Description: At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re on a mission to improve the quality of human life. We’re developing new tools and capabilities to amplify the human experience. To lead this transformative shift in mobility, we’ve built a world-class team in human-centric AI, energy and materials, machine learning, and robotics. As a Research Scientist, you will work with a multidisciplinary team proposing, conducting, and transferring cutting-edge research in Machine Learning for performance-centric applications. You will use large amounts of real-world and simulated data to solve open problems and test your ideas in the real world. You will help to transfer our most successful algorithms and models into real-world advanced assistance systems, deployed in high-pressure environments.  Responsibilities Extend existing AI/ML/robotics algorithms or innovate new algorithms for robust autonomy, including applications around behavior generation such as (multi-agent) reinforcement learning, decision-making, game theory, and learning from demonstrations. Explore data and simulation-driven approaches to decision-making, replacing human assumptions and expertise with learned models and priors. Collaborate with machine learning experts, engineers, and other researchers to develop research questions and overall strategy. Work closely with hardware, software, and simulation engineers to specify, implement, and deliver software prototypes. Work closely with engineers in the Toyota motorsports community to deliver technology with real-world impact .  Qualifications Ph.D. in a relevant technical field (e.g. computer science, mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering) OR equivalent industry experience. Significant expertise three or more of the following: multi-agent systems, decision making, game theory, reinforcement learning, and/or learning from demonstrations. Experience working and integrating with both simulated and real systems and transferring insights from the former to the latter. Proficient at scientific Python, Unix, and a common DL framework (preferably PyTorch). Experience with distributed computing (especially on AWS) is a plus. Proven ability to work both independently and with a diverse team including researchers, engineers, and managers. Communicates technical ideas clearly. Have a high level of initiative and self-motivation; ability to complete tasks within given time constraints. Very strong attention to detail in thinking, implementation, and documentation. Familiarity with and interest in racing, high performance driving, and vehicle dynamics is a plus. You are a reliable teammate. You like to think big and go deeper. You care about openness and delivering with integrity.  Please reference this Candidate Privacy Notice to inform you of the categories of personal information that we collect from individuals who inquire about and/or apply to work for Toyota Research Institute, Inc. or its subsidiaries, including Toyota A.I. Ventures GP, L.P., and the purposes for which we use such personal information.

Description: At the dawn of a new age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every day we use our unique skills and experiences to create, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Our culture inspires employees to dream big, perform with excellence and create incredible products. We provide the resources, inspiration and focus and if you have the passion and courage to dream big, we want to build a better tomorrow with you.  What is your mission? As a Research scientist, you will support ongoing programs and internal research and development efforts, enabling project advancement and emerging technologies.  What will you be working on?  Perform scientific experiments, investigations, observations and related research studies Develop theories for understanding, characterizing, and organizing natural phenomena into a systematic and significant pattern Participate in intellectual property evaluations and development of patent applications How will Lockheed Martin support your mission? To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that encourages differences and big-picture thinking.  Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:  Medical Dental 401k Paid time off Work/life balance Career development Mentorship opportunities Rewards & recognition Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive and comprehensive benefits package.   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  Basic Qualifications:  Bachelors degree electrical engineering, computer engineering, or related engineering discipline US Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a government clearance Experience with MATLAB and Python Exposure to control systems, communications, and signal processing Desired Skills:  Strong background in math, science, and/or engineering Basic understanding of physical systems and models of physical phenomenon Ability to conduct research and development in both laboratory and field environments Proficiency in scientific analysis software, e.g. MATLAB, Python, etc. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications Experience in Digital/Analog Circuit Design Experience using VHDL and/or Verilog Experience using circuit simulation software Experience with industrial robots Experience with machine learning methods and techniques Experience troubleshooting and testing electronics Experience with PCB layout software and tools Excellent communication and presentation skills Experience designing and implementing autonomous systems BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications   Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Megagon Labs is an innovation hub within the Recruit Group, conducting top-notch research and building technologies in Mountain View and Tokyo. We are making impacts through the Recruit Group’s worldwide services and products by collaborating with its subsidiaries such as Indeed and Glassdoor. Our mission is to empower people with better information to make their best decision. The areas we focus are Data Management, Data Integration, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Human-Computer Interaction. Responsibilities Participate in cutting edge research in the following areas: Data Management and Integration, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Knowledge Representation, Bot interfaces, Crowdsourcing, and Visualization. Develop solutions for real world, and work on large scale problems. Minimum Qualifications PhD (or MS working towards a PhD) in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience with an outstanding publication and service track record commensurate with experience. Strong programming experience in one or more of the following: C, C++, Python, Java. Preferred Qualifications Relevant work experience, including full-time industry experience or as a researcher in a lab Strong publication record Ability to design and execute a research agenda. Personal or professional experience in working with people of diverse backgrounds. Additional Benefits We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision & life insurance, etc). Megagon Labs is located in downtown Mountain View, CA, is in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities. Megagon Labs provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Company DescriptionBlock is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams — People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more — provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block.  Job Description Legal Operations is a versatile team charged with improving and maintaining the Legal team's internal processes, systems and technology tools. Our responsibilities include vendor/financial management & legal spend, contracts management, knowledge management, increasing overall operational effectiveness by implementing new technologies and policies, and special projects. Working collaboratively across Block, we keep Legal a well-oiled machine. As a Legal Operations Technology Manager you will help with the department's operations related to tools, technology, process coordination and administration, and support resolution of cross-functional issues. With an eye to process improvement and freeing up attorney time, you will help identify, implement, and maintain innovative processes and systems to improve the efficiency and quality of the Legal Department's services. You will report to the Legal Operations Lead. You will: Manage functional facets of Legal technologies system implementations and enhancements; including managing project plans for multiple parallel projects and ongoing training Provide technical direction on systems managed by Legal Operations, work with internal and external partners to troubleshoot and resolve tech issues Create project and process documentation and self-help tools: dashboards, toolkits, legal training, Q&A, process flows, etc. Establish and improve centralized resources to ensure they are well maintained and accurate Identify opportunities to improve processes, share best practices, and improve efficiency with the Legal team's systems, technologies and controls Develop and maintain Legal Technology Roadmap Craft project status reporting and create executive briefings to update senior leaders and partners Promote the Legal team's professional development and brand, including oversight of internal MCLE programs, and backup MC for Legal team monthly meetings Oversee onboarding and offboarding of Legal team members Manage multiple ad hoc projects within the team as needed Manage a team of 2-3 people   Qualifications You have: 5+ years experience in the areas of technical project management or operations; preference for legal specific experience (in-house or law firm) Experience implementing legal team technology solutions (e.g., contract and document management, approval workflow, e-signature, eDiscovery, knowledge management, etc.). 2+ years of people management experience The ability to build strong relationships within the Counsel team, and other partners including Procurement, IT, Sales, Infosec, and other operational teams Experience using multiple data sets, with the ability to draw conclusions and make informed recommendations Additional Information We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our  I+D page . Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Perks We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes: Healthcare coverage Retirement Plans Employee Stock Purchase Program Wellness perks Paid parental leave Paid time off Learning and Development resources Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD54566975, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans.
